chapter_metadata.subject: English
chapter_metadata.chapter_name: The Wild Boar and the Fox

questions.question: What was the wild boar doing one day?
questions.answer: Sharpening his tusks

questions.question: Against what was the boar sharpening his tusks?
questions.answer: The bark of a tree

questions.question: How was the boar doing his work?
questions.answer: Carefully

questions.question: Who lived in the same forest as the boar?
questions.answer: A fox

questions.question: What was the fox always looking for?

options.text: A chance to make fun of others

questions.answer: A chance to make fun of other animals in the forest

questions.question: What did the fox decide to do when he saw the boar?
questions.answer: Tease him

questions.question: How did the fox act to try and distract the boar?

options.text: As if he was really scared
As if he was very happy

questions.answer: As if he was really scared

questions.question: Did the boar pay attention to the fox at first?

options.text: No, he kept right on with his work
Yes, he started chasing the fox

questions.answer: No, he did not pay any attention to him

questions.question: What does the word 'grin' mean in the story?
questions.answer: Smile

questions.question: What could the fox not see in the forest?
questions.answer: Any hidden enemy or danger

questions.question: According to the boar, what won't there be time for when danger comes?
questions.answer: To sharpen my tusks

questions.question: What are the boar's 'weapons'?
questions.answer: His tusks

questions.question: What is the moral of the story?

options.text: Slow and steady wins the race
It is best to be prepared

questions.answer: It is best to be prepared

questions.question: What should we not leave for the last minute?
questions.answer: Don't leave things to be done at the last minute

questions.question: Which of these words means 'living in a jungle'?
questions.answer: Wild

questions.question: A boar is a type of wild ___.
questions.answer: Pig

questions.question: What is the 'bark' of a tree?
questions.answer: The tough outer covering of the main tree trunk and branches

questions.question: Which animal is 'as sly as a fox'?
questions.answer: The fox

questions.question: Which idiom describes a 'mule'?
questions.answer: As stubborn as a mule

questions.question: Complete the idiom: 'As proud as a ___'.
questions.answer: Peacock

questions.question: What object can be 'sharpened' according to the pointers?
questions.answer: A knife

questions.question: Which animal is 'as slow as a snail'?
questions.answer: Snail

questions.question: What did the fox begin to look at while walking around?

options.text: Left and right and up and down

questions.answer: Left and right and up and down

questions.question: The boar said if he is not ready, he will have to ___.
questions.answer: Suffer

questions.question: Which action word is paired with 'scissors' in the example?
questions.answer: Sharpen

questions.question: Who was sharpening his tusks?
questions.answer: A wild boar was sharpening his tusks.

questions.question: What was the boar using to sharpen his tusks?
questions.answer: The bark of a tree.

questions.question: Where did the fox live?
questions.answer: The fox lived in the same forest as the wild boar.

questions.question: What was the fox's habit?
questions.answer: He was always looking for a chance to make fun of other animals.

questions.question: Why did the fox begin to walk around looking scared?
questions.answer: He decided to tease the wild boar.

questions.question: Did the boar stop his work when he saw the fox?
questions.answer: No, he kept right on with his work.

questions.question: What did the fox ask the boar?
questions.answer: The fox asked, "Why are you doing that? I tried very hard, but I did not see any hidden enemy or danger."

questions.question: What was the boar's reply to the fox's question?
questions.answer: He said that when danger really comes, there won't be time to sharpen his tusks, so they must be ready.

questions.question: What happens if the boar is not ready when danger comes?
questions.answer: He says he will have to suffer.

questions.question: What lesson does the story 'The Wild Boar and the Fox' teach us?
questions.answer: It is best to be prepared and not leave things for the last minute.

questions.question: What are tusks?
questions.answer: A pair of long pointed teeth that some animals like elephants and boars have.

questions.question: What is the meaning of 'grin'?
questions.answer: To grin means to smile.

questions.question: What does the word 'wild' mean in the chapter?
questions.answer: It means living in a jungle.

questions.question: What is a boar?
questions.answer: A wild pig.

questions.question: What is the bark of a tree?
questions.answer: The tough outer covering of the main tree trunk and branches.

questions.question: Which animal is used in the idiom for being busy?
questions.answer: A bee (as busy as a bee).

questions.question: How is a mouse described in the idioms?
questions.answer: As quiet as a mouse.

questions.question: Which animal is 'as strong as an ox'?
questions.answer: An ox.

questions.question: What is the idiom for being brave?
questions.answer: As brave as a lion.

questions.question: Which bird is mentioned in the 'as free as' idiom?
questions.answer: A bird (as free as a bird).

questions.question: Name one thing you can 'sharpen' other than tusks.
questions.answer: A knife, a pencil, or your mind.

questions.question: Name two things you can 'wash'.
questions.answer: Your hands and clothes.

questions.question: Name two things you can 'throw'.
questions.answer: A ball and a stone.

questions.question: Name something you can 'pour'.
questions.answer: Water or juice.

questions.question: What can you 'break' with a hammer?
questions.answer: Laddoos or a stone.

questions.question: Why should you not leave things to be done at the last minute?
questions.answer: Because you might not have enough time and you may suffer, as the boar explained.

questions.question: What was the fox's real intention when he acted scared?
questions.answer: To tease the wild boar and make fun of him.

questions.question: What does the boar consider his 'weapons'?
questions.answer: His sharpened tusks.

questions.question: How did the boar sharpen his tusks 'carefully'?
questions.answer: By rubbing them against the bark of a tree.

questions.question: Which animal is 'as sly as a fox'?
questions.answer: The fox.

questions.question: What is an idiom for being stubborn?
questions.answer: As stubborn as a mule.

questions.question: What does 'as proud as a peacock' mean?
questions.answer: It means being very proud of oneself.

questions.question: Give an example of something you can 'fold'.
questions.answer: A piece of paper or clothes.

questions.question: Give an example of something you can 'repair'.
questions.answer: A broken toy or a bicycle.

questions.question: What can you 'measure'?
questions.answer: Length with a ruler or weight with a scale.

questions.question: Why was the boar sharpening his tusks even when there was no danger?
questions.answer: He wanted to be prepared so that his weapons were ready when danger actually arrived.

questions.question: In the phrase 'looking left and right and up and down', who was doing this?
questions.answer: The fox was doing this.

questions.question: What did the fox try hard to see but couldn't?
questions.answer: Any hidden enemy or danger.

questions.question: Is a wild boar a pet animal?
questions.answer: No, it is a wild animal that lives in the jungle.

questions.question: What is the QR code text for this chapter?
questions.answer: HNF16H.

questions.question: What should the teacher do while reading the story according to pointers?
questions.answer: Read out the story slowly and say each word carefully.

questions.question: Name three objects you can 'decorate'.
questions.answer: A house, a Christmas tree, and a greeting card.

questions.question: What are three things you can 'open'?
questions.answer: A door, a window, and a book.

questions.question: What can you 'paint'?
questions.answer: A picture, a wall, or a fence.

questions.question: What is an idiom for being very slow?
questions.answer: As slow as a snail.

questions.question: What is an idiom for being very strong?
questions.answer: As strong as an ox.

questions.question: What can you 'join'?
questions.answer: Two pieces of paper or broken parts.

questions.question: What can you 'find'?
questions.answer: A lost key or a solution to a problem.

questions.question: Give two reasons why someone might be reading a story.
questions.answer: Because they like it or because it is interesting.

questions.question: What is the situation if Akshay asks 'Why are you reading this story?'
questions.answer: The answer could be 'I like it' or 'It's funny'.
